firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to manage orders and products, focusing on ease of querying, data integrity, and scalability. The primary collection is `/orders`, containing documents representing individual orders. A subcollection `/orders/{orderId}/products` stores products associated with each order. This structure facilitates easy retrieval of all products for a specific order. The design ensures Authorization Independence by not requiring any `get()` calls in the rules, as no authorization data needs to be fetched from parent documents. The structure supports the required QAPs (Rules are not Filters) by ensuring all documents in a collection share the same security requirements.

Denormalization is not strictly required in this case because the security rules primarily rely on user roles which, in this example, are not defined. In a production environment, if access to orders needed to be restricted based on user roles or ownership, those roles or ownership details would be denormalized into each order document.
